chunks.label: Abstract & Contents
covers: Proof structure outline; claim of three revolutionary ideas; language incompleteness

chunks.label: Section 1: Introduction
covers: Motivation for generalization; restating P vs NP; Barbosa's Program

chunks.label: Section 2: Restricted Type X Program
covers: Definition 2.1; three conditions; Notes 1-4 on uniformity and polynomial bounds

chunks.label: Section 3: XG-SAT Definition
covers: Definition 3.1-3.3; well-formed strings; Lz-languages; generalized P and NP (Defs 3.5-3.7)

chunks.label: Section 3.4: Decision problems & Cook-Levin falseness
covers: Definition 3.8; claims Cook-Levin Theorem is false

chunks.label: Section 4: XG-SAT is in NP
covers: Old demonstration using NTM; SAT as special case

chunks.label: Section 5: XG-SAT is not in P
covers: Theorem 5.1; four exhaustive ways Q can act; Propositions 5.2-5.4; diagonalization

chunks.label: Sections 6-10: Barrier theorems & discussion
covers: Baker-Gill-Solovay; Razborov-Rudich; Aaronson-Wigderson; expert advice; freedom & mathematics
